knowledgeGraph.title: HELLP syndrome
knowledgeGraph.type: Also called: hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, low platelet count
knowledgeGraph.description: A serious complication of high blood pressure during pregnancy.Treatable by a medical professionalRequires a medical diagnosisLab tests or imaging always requiredShort-term: resolves within days to weeksCritical: needs emergency careHELLP (hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, low platelet count) syndrome usually develops before the 37th week of pregnancy but can occur shortly after delivery. Many women are diagnosed with preeclampsia beforehand.Symptoms include nausea, headache, belly pain, and swelling.Treatment usually requires delivery of the baby, even if the baby is premature.

attributes.Very rare: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
